abstract: A Queens woman who killed her husband in a hail of 11 bullets but claimed she had been long victimized by him was found not guilty of murder.
snippet: A Queens woman who killed her husband in a hail of 11 bullets but claimed she had been long victimized by him was found not guilty of murder.
lead_paragraph: Updated 2:46 p.m. | Barbara Sheehan, a Queens woman who killed her husband, a former police sergeant, in a hail of 11 bullets while he was shaving was found not guilty on Thursday of second-degree murder. (See updated story here.)
